statement:
Let $\mathbb{F}$ be an arbitrary field. Consider
$\mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F})$, the vector space of all $n \times n$
matrices over $\mathbb{F}$. Moreover, let $\mathcal{GL}_n (\mathbb{F})$
be the full linear group of nonsingular $n \times n$ matrices over
$\mathbb{F}$.

For a linear automorphism
$\varphi : \mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F}) \longrightarrow \mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F})$
the following conditions are equivalent:\

  ------ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   (i)   $\displaystyle \forall\, A \in \mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F}) :\, \det (A) = 0\, \Rightarrow\, \det (\varphi (A)) = 0$,
   (ii)  either $\displaystyle \exists\, P, Q \in \mathcal{GL}_n (\mathbb{F})\, \forall\, A \in \mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F}) :\, \varphi (A) = P A Q$, or $\displaystyle \exists\, P, Q \in \mathcal{GL}_n (\mathbb{F})\, \forall\, A \in \mathcal{M}_n (\mathbb{F}) :\, \varphi (A) = P A^\top Q$.
  ------ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The original proof [@dieud] of the nontrivial implication (i)
$\Rightarrow$ (ii) is based on the fundamental theorem of projective
geometry.

[99]{} J. Dieudonné, Sur une généralisation du groupe orthogonal à
quatre variables, *Arch. Math.* [**1**]{}: 282–287 (1949).
names: Dieudonn\'e theorem on linear preservers of the singular matrices
